Wisdom: الشَّرَهُ يَشِينُ النَّفْسَ وَيُفْسِدُ الدِّينَ وَيُزْرِي بِالْفُتُوَّةِ
enWisdom: Voraciousness tarnishes the soul, corrupts the religion and debases chivalry

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالشَّرَهَ فَإِنَّهُ يُفْسِدُ الْوَرَعَ وَيُدْخِلُ النَّارَ
enWisdom: You must refrain from voraciousness, for indeed it corrupts piety and causes one to enter the fire of hell

Wisdom: إِيَّاكُمْ وَدَنَاءَةَ الشَّرَهِ وَالطَّمَعِ فَإِنَّهُ رَأْسُ كُلِّ شَرٍّ وَمَزْرَعَةُ الذُّلِّ وَمُهِينُ النَّفْسِ وَمُتْعِبُ الْجَسَدِ
enWisdom: Beware of the vileness of voraciousness and greed, for verily it is the root of all evil, the plantation of disgrace, the debaser of the soul and the exhauster of the body
The root of avarice is covetousness and its fruit is reproach
The fruit of voraciousness is rushing towards faults [and vices]
The voracious one will never be seen happy
There is no chastity with voraciousness
One whose soul is voracious becomes disgraced despite his affluence
There is no contentment with avarice
